data.text:
Salamanca Climate Summary

Located at an elevation of None meters (0 feet) above sea level, Salamanca has a Mediterranean, warm summer climate (Classification: Csb). The district’s yearly temperature is 14.18ºC (57.52ºF) and it is -2.43% lower than Spain’s averages. Salamanca typically receives about 59.26 millimeters (2.33 inches) of precipitation and has 99.16 rainy days (27.17% of the time) annually.
